messages: 6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (06:37): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049: Look what you made me do: https://github.com 6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2alitz/GameBoy-Online/commit/318a840ce10e90d87391d83d0b0a84dbb1290518
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (06:37): I reverted a revert in response to the yes. :/
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (06:38): "Reverted a revert (I must not go derper)."
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (06:39): Now I use -1 to 1 of the amplitude range
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (06:40): I had used 0 to 1 previously because drop-offs were less noticeable with that range
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (06:40): but utilizing -1 to 0 doubles the volume/ :D
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (06:41): though this is not what real gameboy hardware does
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (06:41): Gameboys only have a positive scale amplitude
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (06:41): but this doesn't matter, because computer speakers are much way better quality
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (06:42): so the low pass attribute natural to a positive scale is unrelated even to when I was using it
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (06:42): and computer OSes apply such a filter anyhow usually

6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (06:44): notes instead of the amplitude going from 0 to 1, it now goes from -1 to 1, which means natural filter effects from speakers themselves apply differently in this case.
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (06:44): so the sound may marginally be different if you have shitty speakers
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (06:44): let me know when it goes to 11 :D
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (06:44): or your OS does weird shit
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (06:45): notes that for most of the time, the amplitude will actually be somewhere between -1 and 0 now
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (06:46): is throwing your computer speakers' magnets in reverse
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (06:47): 0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17: Because each audio channel (total of 4) gets at most an amplitude of 0.5
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (06:48): And I adjust by subtracting -1 from the running total
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (06:48): well then.....technically make it 10, but label it 11 :D
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (06:48): theoretically
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (06:48): even if it's technically 1
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (06:48): yeah, i'm just being dumb, don't mind me
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (06:48): 0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17: I don't even know why I'm discussing this here. :/

0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (06:49): sunday night an bored?

6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (06:53): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049: There might be a decimal point round up problem potentially causing volume for one of my audio channels to just barely get over 0.50 amplitude
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (06:53): and if all channels do 0.50 with the one with "a little extra from FPU round up" then I might get an amplitude like 1.00000000000000001
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (06:53): I doubt that will mess up webkit audio
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (06:54): Because I believe these audio apis clip any amplitude beyond -1-1
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (06:54): so anything above 1 equals 1
c22cc4227c3fd1380b44a8169f85c844 (06:55): grant, why did you switch from 0 1 to -1 1
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (06:55): c22cc4227c3fd1380b44a8169f85c844: double the maximum volume
c22cc4227c3fd1380b44a8169f85c844 (06:56): is this one of those american "bigger must be better" things?
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (06:56): So I can blast gameboy music at double the volume as from before

6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (06:57): c22cc4227c3fd1380b44a8169f85c844: I think your other tab right now is youjizz and you're carrying on a conversation here while multitasking with that site. D:

0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (07:03): thinking i should consider sleep before too long, and know we're moving offices before the end of february
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (07:03): so that'll be fun
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:03): moving always gets you out of a rut for some time
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (07:04): it'll be to a more proper office too, instead of a couple rooms in an older building
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (07:04): right next to train tracks :\
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (07:05): the current place is next to tracks, the new place won't be :D
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (07:05): i can't wait, i'm anxious for it all
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:16): forgot to mention a gameboy does additive channel mixing, not averaging
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:17): So the voltages add up
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (07:17): and no division
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (07:21): time to crash for the night
